instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.AVREF_SMC: What is AVREF_SMC? AVREF_SMC is a reference voltage provided to the SMC so that its sensors have a reference to work from, this should be 3.3v.
definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..
definitions.PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC: What is PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC? PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC Is a reference voltage for the SMCâ€™s voltage sensors & other sensors..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A very slow
threads.message:
Hi, 

I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A that only powers on, if the power on button is pressed for about 10 seconds, and when it boots it is very slow in OS.

Don't know what can be causing this. 

Can you help?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A very slow
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A very slow
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A very slow
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A very slow
threads.message:
It was a bad cap.

TKS!

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A very slow

It was a bad cap.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A very slow
threads.message:
Hi, again.

It seams that I have another problem with this one: It doesn't recognize any battery. Already tried a know good battery and with same problem. It isen't recognized in the OS, neither by the board (doesn't charge).

Can you help?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A very slow
threads.message:
Check voltage and diode mode to ground on SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.
What is the exact <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage?

Did you try known good LIO board?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A very slow
threads.message:
It was a bad contact on the battery conector.

TKS
